intro: Commelina triquetra, commonly known as the three-angled spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread vegetatively, forming dense mats. Commelina triquetra is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in diverse soil conditions.
